quote.text: After failure, it is possible to keep going– and to fail better.
quote.author: Slavoj Žižek
quote.aiInsight:
• Parenthood
    • Embrace failure as a vital part of growth; as a parent, guiding your children through setbacks teaches resilience and the wisdom to learn from mistakes.
    • Fostering an environment where it is safe to err helps children understand that each failure is an opportunity to improve and ultimately become better human beings.
  • Leadership
    • As a leader, the willingness to persist after failure and to fail better is a powerful example, encouraging your team to innovate and take calculated risks without the fear of imperfection.
    • Each misstep offers crucial lessons; by reflecting on and learning from your failures, you can guide your organization toward greater clarity, purpose, and enduring success.
  • Product Management
    • In product management, setbacks are the crucible in which true innovation is forged; embracing failure as a stepping stone enables you to refine strategies and bring forth better products.
    • Accepting failure and iterating improves not just products, but also processes, instilling a culture where continuous improvement and adaptability lead to long-term achievement.
